item.title: The Bleisure app emerged as the winner of the Sabre hackathon
item.description:
Source: Sabre. From left: Isolda Josy and Pranay Roy, Moments; Mendis from Sabre Travel Network Asia Pacific; and Marco Angeles, Moments. A team from Singapore won the 24-hour Destination Hack: Singapore, Sabre’s inaugural Asia Pacific hackathon. Participants were tasked with designing a new technology app that could revolutionize travel – from planning and booking to the overall experience. The winning app, Moments, caters to the increasing demand for “bleisure” travel in the Asia Pacific region...

item.title: Styletag is known for identifying the latest fashion trends globally
item.description:
Want to stay stylish at work? South Korea’s SK Planet has refreshed its Styletag mobile app using trends from New York Fashion Week, which wrapped up on February 13th. Source: Styletag page at the Play Store Styletag gathers and organizes user-submitted fashion content worldwide, offering both style inspiration and shopping details. The app includes contributions from professional photographers, amateur enthusiasts, and invited fashion experts. item.title: The FastGig app has been released to connect flexible workers with job opportunities
item.description:
FastCo, the company known for its Asian non-executive job platform FastJobs, has launched FastGig, an app designed for the expanding gig economy. FastCo claims this is one of the first apps specifically for gig workers in Southeast Asia. FastGig, operating as Singapore’s first workforce-as-a-service (WaaS) platform, connects skilled flexible workers with companies facing staffing shortages, particularly during peak seasons. Julian Tan, FastCo’s Founder & CEO, highlights FastGig as a solution to a significant market gap, providing flexibility for both workers and businesses and transforming Singapore’s gig economy...

item.description:

item.title: Tips from Akamai for optimizing app engagement
item.description:
A report from Akamai highlights that 95% of gamers quit playing a game within the first month. The company states that slow loading times are a major factor, causing 40% of players to abandon games. item.description:
Source: Google Asia Pacific blog. Beginning January 22nd, individuals passing through Mumbai Central station in India will have access to complimentary, high-speed Wi-Fi provided by Google. This service is part of an initiative revealed in September 2015 to bring high-speed public Wi-Fi to 400 train stations across India. Collaborating with Indian Railways, which manages one of the world’s most extensive railway systems, and RailTel, a provider of internet services as RailWire through its fiber network along many railway lines, Google’s Access & Energy team aims to equip 100 of India’s busiest stations with Wi-Fi by the end of 2016, with the remaining stations to follow shortly after...

item.description:

item.title: The intelligent coach for individuals with diabetes is designed to improve long-term quality of life
item.description:
A new “smart coach” service aims to assist individuals with type 2 diabetes in developing healthier lifestyle choices for improved long-term well-being. Diabetes, particularly when poorly managed, can result in complications such as vision loss, kidney issues, and nerve damage. It has also been linked to Alzheimer’s disease, sometimes referred to as “type 3 diabetes.” The global rise of diabetes presents significant healthcare cost concerns. Holmusk, a digital health and data analytics company, highlights that over 415 million people worldwide have diabetes, a figure that continues to grow annually...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-intelligent-coach-for-individuals-with-diabetes-is-designed-to-improve-long-term-quality-of-life/

item.title: The membership promotion at EatPlayLive is available until the end of the year
item.description:
Source: EatPlayLive Facebook page. Live life on the edge. The Asian lifestyle app EatPlayLive, recently introduced in Singapore, has a limited-time offer for a one-year membership. For a limited time, you can get a year of membership for S$100, discounted from the regular price of S$180. EatPlayLive offers enticing deals and experiences that could potentially save members thousands of dollars annually. These range from dining discounts at renowned restaurants like Senso, Chef’s Table, and Angelina to unique experiences at establishments such as Culinaryon, Arteastiq, The Fullerton Spa, and Amara Sanctuary Resort Sentosa...

item.title: If apps don't offer speed, simplicity, and security, consumers will not hesitate to abandon them
item.description:
Source: CA Technologies infographic. People are pickier than ever about the apps they use, so businesses that don’t offer a good app experience could lose a significant portion of their customers. A regional study* sponsored by CA Technologies shows that mobile and desktop applications in the Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ) region have become key to earning customer loyalty. Software: the New Battleground for Brand Loyalty – A survey of 1,449 consumers and 259 business decision-makers across five APJ nations pinpointed three major factors influencing the customer experience: Source: CA Technologies infographic...

item.title: ESET updates Mobile Security app for Android
item.description:
ESET, a company known for its digital security solutions, has launched an improved version of ESET Mobile Security in the Asia Pacific region. This enhanced version, specifically its premium offering, boasts advanced anti-theft features designed to help Android users locate their lost or stolen devices. [Image of ESET Mobile Security App] Source: Play Store. The app’s free version provides essential protection, such as comprehensive device scans, scans of downloaded applications, and basic anti-theft functions...

item.title: Booqed offers a selection of workspaces available for rent
item.description:
Booqed, an online marketplace for booking meeting rooms and workspaces, has introduced its mobile app on the Apple App Store. This app offers a convenient way to find and reserve available spaces in a city, allowing users to book instantly or in advance and make payments directly from their smartphones or tablets. Businesses can also benefit from this service by monetizing their underutilized meeting or conference rooms. Booqed provides a platform for them to list and rent out these spaces...

item.title: Singtel is encouraging subscribers to use their phones for payment at the supermarket
item.description:
A picture of a Dash payment reader at a FairPrice checkout. Starting November 17th, shoppers can use Singtel’s Dash mobile payment app at over 200 NTUC FairPrice locations, including their supermarkets, Xtra hypermarkets, and standalone Cheers stores. Gan Siok Hoon, Singtel’s VP of mCommerce, Consumer Singapore, stated that as a major fintech provider, they were excited to partner with Singapore’s largest retailer, FairPrice, to offer this fast and secure payment option to their over half a million daily shoppers...

item.title: The Flickr App for iPad has been optimized for iOS 8
item.description:
Yahoo has launched a new Flickr app designed for iPads, allowing users seamless photo management across all devices. Yahoo claims the app is optimized for iOS 8, providing an enhanced experience for capturing, editing, and browsing images. Source: Yahoo. Current iPad users can update their existing Flickr app, while new users can download it from the App Store. The app supports multiple languages, including English, French, Indonesian, Korean, Chinese, and Vietnamese...

item.title: AsiaKredit has introduced a consumer lending platform in the Philippines
item.description:
AsiaKredit’s goal is to make financial services more accessible in the Philippines. They aim to achieve this by making credit easier to obtain and improving the approval rates for individuals with limited or no credit history. Source: pera247 website. Screenshot of the pera247 app. Pera247 is a completely digital platform offering short-term loans, up to 90 days, through a mobile wallet. These loans are typically small, unsecured, and target consumers with limited financial history...

item.title: Guests at Emaar can customize their experience using the latest apps
item.description:
Source: Emaar. Emaar introduces custom-designed apps, linked with their internal systems, to improve the customer experience. • Apps for Address Hotels + Resorts, Vida Hotels and Resorts, Palace Downtown, and Manzil Downtown are now available. item.title: Word Lens assists travelers in translating signs instantly
item.description:
Quest Visual, the company behind the augmented reality app Word Lens, has decided to offer the app and all of its language packs for free for a limited time. This includes languages like English, French, Italian, Portuguese, and Russian. This gesture of thanks to their users comes as the company transitions to new ownership under Google. item.title: Fit Spotting assists users in finding hotels that have excellent gym facilities
item.description:
Fit Spotting is an iOS mobile application that helps users discover, evaluate, and read reviews about hotel gyms and fitness facilities. Tarek Atwan, the creator of Fit Spotting, explained that as a frequent traveler and fitness enthusiast, he found it challenging to locate reliable reviews and images of hotel gyms while booking accommodations. Information was scattered across the internet, lacking a central platform where users could access consolidated feedback, ratings, and photos to accurately depict the hotel’s fitness offerings...

item.title: By 2022, consumers are projected to spend over $155 billion on apps
item.description:
Source: App Annie. App Annie predicts app trends will change by 2022. Figures are in US dollars. A new report by App Annie, a mobile app data and insights company, projects global consumer spending on apps to reach US$156.5 billion by 2022, a 92% increase from 2017. The App Annie Forecast 2017-2022 highlights major trends expected to shape the app economy in the coming years. Global first-time app downloads are predicted to rise by 45% between 2017 and 2022, hitting 258...

item.title: LINE has implemented encryption for its chat rooms
item.description:
Source: LINE. The new encryption indicator is in the shape of a lock icon. LINE users in Singapore can now experience increased privacy and security for a safer user experience. The latest version of the LINE messaging app introduces a new lock icon indicator. This icon helps users identify chat rooms protected with end-to-end encryption. The icon, gradually being released globally, signifies that messages are only readable by the sender and recipient, remaining secure even as they pass through LINE’s servers...

item.title: Support World Vision in the Philippines by using the Gift It app to make a contribution
item.description:
World Vision, a charitable organization, has teamed up with Gift It, a crowdgifting platform. Gift It allows users to create personalized campaigns to fund gifts from various stores or support charitable causes through foundation partners. Jun Godornes, World Vision’s Director for National Resources and Development, highlights the app’s convenience, stating it simplifies giving while raising awareness for their programs that support children through education, disaster relief, and economic development. Gift It also features a social aspect, enabling friends to contribute collaboratively...

item.title: The partnership between SMRT JV and Hailo Singapore will enable the use of electronic receipts for taxi rides
item.description:
SMRT Road Holdings (SMRT Roads) and London-based taxi app developer Hailo Network Holdings (Hailo) have partnered to launch Hailo Singapore. This joint venture will introduce a new taxi booking application in Singapore. Benny Lim, Managing Director of SMRT Roads, believes this collaboration will improve the passenger experience. He stated that combining Hailo’s technology with SMRT’s operational knowledge will create a seamless booking process for both passengers and drivers. Ron Zeghibe, Executive Chairman and Co-Founder of Hailo Network, emphasized Hailo’s goal of optimizing taxi services globally...

item.title: Alizz Islamic Bank has enhanced its mobile application
item.description:
Source: Alizz Islamic Bank. The app. Alizz Islamic Bank has introduced a redesigned mobile banking app and online platform to solidify its position as a customer experience frontrunner in Oman. The dual-language app, compatible with both Android and iOS devices, boasts high-level security features and a self-registration option. Users can conveniently manage web banking logins, money transfers, bill payments, and other transactions using QR codes. The app is compatible with 3D Touch technology and is the first of its kind in Oman to provide in-app alerts for new transactions and payment reminders...

item.description:
Emirates airline has introduced the Emirates App for iPad, available globally through the App Store. This app allows users to easily explore destinations and manage their Emirates travel experiences. With a simple tap, users can discover information on over 130 Emirates destinations across six continents and learn about the airline’s renowned services. The Emirates App for iPad simplifies travel management for Emirates customers, whether they’re on the move, in flight, or at home...

item.title: A new version of McAfee Mobile Security has been launched by Intel Security
item.description:
Intel Security has released the newest version of McAfee Mobile Security (MMS) for Android devices. This updated software offers enhanced security and improved device performance. As people increasingly rely on their mobile devices for personal and sensitive tasks, MMS provides protection and addresses the need for faster speeds, longer battery life, and secure browsing on Android phones and tablets. This new version of MMS allows users to maximize their Android device performance with features that optimize speed and battery life...

item.title: Mobile app-driven ATMs without screens could be the future of banking
item.description:
EyeLock, a company that provides iris-based identity authentication solutions, has partnered with Diebold, a global provider of self-service technology, to create a screenless, compact ATM concept. A prototype called Irving is currently being tested by Citibank in the US. This innovative ATM design eliminates the need for a PIN pad, card reader, or screen. Instead, users conduct transactions through a mobile app on their smartphone. The system utilizes near field communication (NFC), quick response (QR) code technology, and EyeLock’s iris scanning to verify the customer’s identity at the ATM...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/mobile-app-driven-atms-without-screens-could-be-the-future-of-banking/

item.title: TaxiPixi is working to increase the popularity of taxis in India and other countries
item.description:
A new free taxi booking app called TaxiPixi is gaining popularity in India. Available on Android, iOS, and online, this less-than-a-year-old service offers reliable options for booking cabs, motorcycles, or auto-rickshaws for point-to-point trips or hourly packages. TaxiPixi’s online home page Co-founder and CEO Kajal Dubey believes that the biggest obstacles to increased taxi use are the uncertainty of finding a ride and the perception that taxis are much more expensive than driving...

item.title: The TaxiPixi app has been awarded the mBillionth Award in South Asia for its taxi booking services
item.description:
TaxiPixi, a mobile application for booking taxis, has won the award for best Travel App in South Asia at the 5th annual mBillionth Awards. The app works by connecting customers to taxi drivers from different companies in real time. The mBillionth Awards recognize exceptional mobile applications and digital material from eight South Asian countries: Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, the Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan, and Sri Lanka. Source: TaxiPixi. “This award boosts our confidence and reaffirms our commitment to providing a comprehensive solution for urban transportation,” said TaxiPixi CEO Kajal Dubey...

item.title: New touchless camera app is now accessible
item.description:
Source: Crunchfish. Crunchfish, in partnership with MOMAX, has introduced MOMAX cam, a hands-free camera application for selfie sticks. MOMAX cam allows users to take pictures using gestures, touch, and Bluetooth. Here are some of its key features: Snap photos with a simple V-sign gesture. Use a touchless grab gesture to set the timer for capturing photos from up to 3 meters away. Switch between the front and rear cameras, as well as zoom in and out, using the Bluetooth trigger to get the perfect shot...

item.title: Evernote introduces a new and improved app with a redesigned interface
item.description:
Evernote has announced three updates: a brand new app, a significantly enhanced feature, and a major app redesign. As detailed in a recent blog post, the company will introduce “Scannable,” a mobile scanning app. Scannable can transform physical items like business cards and receipts into digital content that can be easily shared and acted upon. It also integrates with the ScanSnap Evernote Edition desktop scanner, enabling shared scanning across a user’s network and essentially turning it into a shared office resource...

item.title: Users of Didi Kuaidi, GrabTaxi, Lyft, and Ola can now utilize their apps in different countries
item.description:
The concept of “roaming” has evolved from phone services to ATM cash withdrawals. Now, a partnership similar to the airline industry’s Star Alliance is bringing global roaming to ride-hailing apps that were once limited to specific regions. Didi Kuaidi, GrabTaxi, Lyft, and Ola have expanded their initial ride-sharing agreement, first established between Lyft and Didi Kuaidi in September. This expanded partnership now encompasses a significant portion of the world’s population, covering nearly all of Southeast Asia, India, China, and the United States...

item.title: Starbucks Indonesia has launched the Starbucks Mobile App
item.description:
Source: Starbucks. Use the mobile app to make purchases at Starbucks. Starbucks Indonesia has launched its mobile app, offering customers a quick and easy way to pay at over 260 stores across the country. Expanding upon the cashless Starbucks Card system introduced in 2013, the Starbucks Indonesia mobile app (available on iPhone and Android) allows customers to pay for purchases by scanning a barcode linked to their registered Starbucks Card...

item.title: Avast Wi-Fi Finder helps you find trustworthy Wi-Fi connections globally
item.description:
Avast has released Avast Wi-Fi Finder, an Android app that helps users locate trustworthy, fast, and secure Wi-Fi connections no matter where they are. The app uses a map interface to display recommended and crowdsourced hotspots. “Many of us, whether traveling or working remotely, have struggled to find dependable and secure Wi-Fi,” said Gagan Singh, President of mobile at Avast. “With Avast Wi-Fi Finder, consumers can now easily locate a safe and fast Wi-Fi connection at the gym, hotel, airport, bus station, library, or café...

item.title: Traveloka will introduce awards based on audience participation for Asia's Got Talent
item.description:
Traveloka, a popular Southeast Asian travel app, is sponsoring the second season of AXN’s Asia’s Got Talent and introducing the Traveloka Awards. The Traveloka Awards will recognize the contestant with the most compelling background, emphasizing unique talents and strong family and friend connections. Premiering this October, Asia’s Got Talent on AXN will feature ten episodes, including auditions, semifinals, a finale, and a results show revealing the winner of a $100,000 prize from Traveloka...

item.description:
Source: itSeez3D page on the App Store. itSeez3D, a company that develops 3D scanning software, has released an updated version of their mobile scanning app, also named itSeez3D. This app, designed for use with the Occipital Structure Sensor 3D device, now allows iPads to generate lifelike, full-body 3D models. This updated app serves as a valuable tool for 3D printing, enabling the scanning of a full-color figurine in under two minutes...

item.title: The new version of Flickr is now available for iOS 9
item.description:
Yahoo’s Flickr app for iOS 9 now includes features designed for the updated operating system. Source: Yahoo. The app utilizes 3D Touch on the latest iPhones. This allows users to preview content by pressing lightly on the screen. For example, in the Camera Roll, lightly pressing a photo shows a preview, while a harder press expands it to full screen. Another 3D Touch feature, “Quick Actions,” lets users perform certain tasks directly from the app icon...

item.title: Singtel is providing complimentary content and data to commemorate Singapore's 51st anniversary
item.description:
To commemorate Singapore’s 51st birthday on August 9th, Singtel is offering customers complimentary mobile data, alongside free access to Singtel TV and Singtel TV GO. Postpaid mobile users will enjoy free data from 12:01 am to 11:59 pm on August 9th, allowing them to connect with family and friends on social media, stream music, and watch videos. From August 5th to 9th, Singtel TV subscribers will have free access to over 140 channels, including popular options like Disney Channel, National Geographic Channel HD, FOX Movie Premium HD, KBS World HD, Astro Ria, and Sun TV...

Source: HelloTalk app page at the Play Store. The mobile language learning app HelloTalk has reached over one million registered users globally, according to its developer, HelloTalk. The HelloTalk app allows users to teach each other their native languages using their mobile devices. Users can communicate in real-time with native speakers through various features, helping them practice their target language. item.title: Subscribe to Grabz for exclusive insider privileges
item.description:
Source: Grabz website. Grabz is a subscription service that provides its members with exclusive benefits and special offers. Using location-based alerts and a wide range of affiliated businesses, the app connects its subscribers with exclusive deals and privileges in their city. For a monthly fee of S$15.98, premium members enjoy invitations to events and promotions such as discounted business class airfare and exclusive access to limited-edition luxury watches. Premium members also get access to the Grabz Concierge, a personalized booking service that assists members with securing reservations at clubs and getting on guest lists for exclusive parties in Singapore...
